title: Lindsay Lohan CONFIRMS she will return to The Masked Singer for season two
text:
Speculation is rife that actress Lindsay Lohan will be 'dumped' from The Masked Singer Australia.

But on Tuesday, the 33-year-old confirmed she plans to film a second season of the hit Channel 10 show.

Speaking on the Hit Network's Hughesy & Kate radio show, the Parent Trap star said she hopes to return next year.

'I'm bringing an American': Lindsay Lohan has confirmed she WILL return for a second season of The Masked Singer Australia, despite rumours to the contrary

'For season two I'm bringing an American with me,' Lindsay said.

The Hollywood star went on to praise her fellow panelists, including Dave Hughes, Dannii Minogue and Jackie 'O' Henderson.

'It was just a really good experience. It was welcoming and very warm,' she said.

'It was just a really good experience. It was welcoming and very warm,' Lindsay said of The Masked Singer panel (pictured)

Meanwhile, Lindsay exclusively told DailyMail.com she 'loves the Masked Singer' and hopes to do a second season.

She also told her fans not the believe the 'lies' being published about her in the Australian media.

The 'lies' Lindsay is referring to cropped up recently in a report by New Idea, which alleged that the network was replacing her due to her 'tricky demands.'

'She was tricky with demands and had a complete lack of respect for time schedules,' a source told the magazine.

Lindsay explained, however, that she enjoyed her time on the show and is in constant communication with the network.

'We all speak daily, all of us with heads of the network are all on a group chat together,' she said.

Channel 10 is yet to confirm a second season of The Masked Singer and has not made any statement about the judging panel.

Speaking on the Kyle and Jackie O Show last week, Lindsay denied reports she was a 'diva' on set and said people were just digging for 'negativity'.

'People want to find the negative for no reason. There was nothing negative about [filming The Masked Singer],' she said.

Waiting game: Channel 10 is yet to confirm a second season of The Masked Singer and has not made any statement about the judging panel. Pictured (left to right): Jackie 'O' Henderson, Lindsay Lohan, Dave Hughes and Dannii Minogue

Radio host Jackie 'O' Henderson, who is also a judge on The Masked Singer, added that production was 'the best experience' and 'so much fun'.

However, former Masked Singer contestant Wendell Sailor has stated publicly that Lindsay's long breaks disrupted production.

'About a minute before I had to perform, they said, 'Lindsay's hungry, she's going to have a break.' It was like an hour break! We were there for a while,' Wendell said on KIIS FM last week.

The retired rugby player, 45, explained he was forced to wait in his dressing room during Lindsay's break because he wasn't allowed to talk to anyone on set.
description: Speculation is rife that actress Lindsay Lohan will be 'dumped' from The Masked Singer Australia.
authors: Caleb Taylor For Daily Mail Australia
